intro: Phlomoides tadshikistanica, commonly known as the Tadzhikistan phlomoides, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Lamiaceae. It is native to Central Asia, particularly found in the mountainous regions of Tajikistan. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It produces small, tubular flowers that are often purple or blue in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
